page.title: 03INDUSTRY - BRITISH AEROSPACE
page.content: The Warton Division of British Aerospace is Europe's most experienced combat aircraft research, development, production and flight-test organisation. With the Jaguar and Tornado aeroplanes it is spearheading Great Britain's military project for the latter part of the twentieth century and beyond. The Warton Division has been designing, developing and building subsonic and supersonic military aircraft since 1945. Since 1963, it has become a world leader in the development of the of the variable-geometry wing. The division employs approximately 16000 people, the majority coming from the Fylde area. British Aerospace do not provide a free transport service, but do have an arrangement with Ribble Motors to allocate fee paying buses in the mornings and at finishing times.
